replies.author: @ChessHistorian
replies.content:
Really cool to get to see interviews like this in advance of an election involving them. 

This is the first long-form interview with Trump after he was shot I think(?), and seeing how age and trauma has affected a former President now running for reelection in this political climate, it's just super interesting, and I wish everyone the best for having serious conversations and chatting honestly about what's important to them. 

I don't really pick sides often because I don't know much and I'm a nobody, but I really don't like the trend of de-platforming people who are relevant to the modern world's issues, no matter what I think of them, so, I'm glad that we have TC's interview of Putin on record and I'm glad we have this. These are valuable historical chronicles. I respect that there is a lot that goes unsaid in these interviews, but I don't think for a moment that I could fill the shoes of either the interviewer or any of the guests that appear on this program. It's like, a completely different world, being one of those guys. 

My own personal biggest responsibility is taking my dog out to poop every morning, ha. How could I possibly know what people at that level really sound like, if I didn't have this stuff?

replies.author: @ChessHistorian
replies.content:
Really cool to get to see interviews like this in advance of an election involving them. 

This is the first long-form interview with Trump after he was shot I think(?), and seeing how age and trauma has affected a former President now running for reelection in this political climate, it's just super interesting, and I wish everyone the best for having serious conversations and chatting honestly about what's important to them. 

I don't really pick sides often because I don't know much and I'm a nobody, but I really don't like the trend of de-platforming people who are relevant to the modern world's issues, no matter what I think of them, so, I'm glad that we have TC's interview of Putin on record and I'm glad we have this. These are valuable historical chronicles. I respect that there is a lot that goes unsaid in these interviews, but I don't think for a moment that I could fill the shoes of either the interviewer or any of the guests that appear on this program. It's like, a completely different world, being one of those guys. 

My own personal biggest responsibility is taking my dog out to poop every morning, ha. How could I possibly know what people at that level really sound like, if I didn't have this stuff? 

Been a fan since the Magnus and Hikaru interviews. Keep it up, m8. Stay boring. I wager all honest journalism is a little boring. It may be of more immediate value to the news companies to be entertaining, but it's more valuable to history/tomorrow's kids to stay boring.

Additionally, his other ventures, such as Trump Airlines, Trump University, and Trump Vodka, were high-profile failures that either lost money or shut down entirely.

This pattern reveals a business model prone to risk, failure, and reliance on bankruptcy protections rather than sustained success. @@HippohappyttYour cynicism is not a virtue. Better than na√Øvet√© in some ways. Step past it into maturity. You are capable of choosing to understand the implication of negative outcomes. But you are incapable of seeing if there is anything else. 

Do you know how you catch a liar? By checking what he says broadly, and to whom. 

For example. He avoided much here. What does that say? He doesn‚Äôt have anything that sounds right to say about those questions. He views them as dangerous. So that‚Äôs past cynicism. I think millions see the same. 

You may not have the capacity to parse what is true all the time. But you can understand many things if you have an understanding of what is true. And a standard of what is good. And you use one to measure against the other.

The truth as a destination is bumkiss. The truth as an aim is better. Search for what‚Äôs true the most consistently over the most time.

Good as an object is bumkiss. Good as a function of an idea circumstance is better. Find what good is worthy to stand forever, and you‚Äôve found good worthy to manifest once.

Measure the one to the other, and that is a vision you can use to see by. A looking glass. A constellation. And a ship to captain. 

This shite you‚Äôve got now is nothing.
